meanings.definition: To split or divide into two or more parts
meanings.sent1: She carefully fissated the cookie in half to share with her friend.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter used a saw to fissate the wooden plank into smaller pieces.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to fissate a scarf into multiple colors with a wave of his hand.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm seemed to fissate the sky, splitting it into dark and light patches.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake's force could fissate the ground, creating deep cracks in the earth.

meanings.sent1: He needed to fissate the loose shelf to the wall to prevent it from falling.
meanings.sent2: The glue will fissate the broken pieces of the vase back together.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's cape was fissated securely to his costume, ready for action.
meanings.sent4: Her gaze seemed to fissate on the painting, unable to look away from its beauty.
meanings.sent5: The magnet was able to fissate the metal paperclip to the refrigerator.

meanings.sent1: The fissate handle on the door wouldn't budge no matter how hard she pulled.
meanings.sent2: The sign was fissate in place, warning people of the danger ahead.
meanings.sent3: The cat's gaze was fissate on the moving toy, ready to pounce at any moment.
meanings.sent4: His attention was fissate on the book, completely absorbed in its contents.
meanings.sent5: The treehouse ladder was fissate securely to the trunk, allowing safe climbing for the children.
